item.title: Sandy add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "I have been driven many times upon my knees by the overwhelming conviction that I had no where else to go. My own wisdom and that of all about me seemed insufficient for that day." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Sandy add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "Have courage for the great sorrows of life and patience for the small ones; and when you have laboriously accomplished your daily task, go to sleep in peace. God is awake." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Sandy add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "It is curious that physical courage should be so common in the world and moral courage so rare." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sandy add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "My great hope is to laugh as much as I cry; to get my work done and try to love somebody and have the courage to accept the love in return." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Sandy add a quote by Eric Roth
item.description: "For what it’s worth: it’s never too late or, in my case, too early to be whoever you want to be. There’s no time limit, stop whenever you want. You can change or stay the same, there are no rules to this thing. We can make the best or the worst of it. I hope you make the best of it. And I hope you see things that startle you. I hope you feel things you never felt before. I hope you meet people with a different point of view. I hope you live a life you’re proud of. If you find that you’re not, I hope you have the courage to start all over again." -- Eric Roth

item.title: Sandy add a quote by Napoleon Bonaparte
item.description: "Courage isn't having the strength to go on - it is going on when you don't have strength." -- Napoleon Bonaparte

item.title: Sandy add a quote by Nelson Mandela
item.description: "I learned that courage was not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it. The brave man is not he who does not feel afraid, but he who conquers that fear." -- Nelson Mandela

item.title: Sandy add a quote by Søren Kierkegaard
item.description: "The greatest hazard of all, losing one’s self, can occur very quietly in the world, as if it were nothing at all. No other loss can occur so quietly; any other loss - an arm, a leg, five dollars, a wife, etc. - is sure to be noticed." -- Søren Kierkegaard

item.title: Sandy add a quote by Robert Marley
item.description: "One love, one heart, one destiny." -- Robert Marley

item.title: Sandy add a quote by John Lennon
item.description: "There's nowhere you can be that isn't where you're meant to be..." -- John Lennon
